Puerto Jiménez

The Puerto Jiménez is a small town in the south of Costa Rica. It is a beautiful place with a lot of nature and wildlife. This town is the primary gateway to the Corcovado National Park, one of the most biodiverse places in the world.

How to get there

The best way to get to Puerto Jiménez is by plane from Juan Santamaría International Airport in San José. You can also take a bus from San José to Puerto Jiménez.

Read more

The most important places around there

Here you can find the most important places around Puerto Jiménez.

Activities

Corcovado National Park

Embark on an unforgettable journey through Corcovado National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage site renowned as one of Earth's most biodiverse sanctuaries. Experience close encounters with exotic wildlife, trek through pristine rainforest, and discover hidden waterfalls in this natural paradise.

Local Trail Hikes

Explore the stunning natural beauty around Puerto Jiménez with guided hikes outside Corcovado National Park. Discover hidden waterfalls, spot local wildlife, and experience the rich biodiversity of the Osa Peninsula.

Kayaking

Navigate through stunning mangrove forests and serene waterways in Puerto Jiménez's premier kayaking destinations. Our diverse network of rivers and protected coves offers both peaceful nature exploration and exciting adventures for paddlers of all skill levels.

Canopy Tour

Soar through the rainforest canopy on exciting zip-line adventures. Experience the forest from a bird's eye view while enjoying stunning vistas of the Golfo Dulce and surrounding landscape.

Gold Panning Tour

Discover the fascinating history of gold panning in the Osa Peninsula. Learn traditional techniques and try your luck finding gold in local rivers while learning about the region's rich mining heritage.

Guides

Jairi

Specialized in photography tours, Jairi will help you capture the perfect shots of wildlife and landscapes in and around Corcovado National Park.

Tomas

An experienced nature guide with extensive knowledge of local flora and fauna. Perfect for birdwatching and wildlife spotting tours.

Gabriel

Local expert with deep knowledge of the Osa Peninsula's hidden gems. Specializes in customized tours and unique experiences.

Craftsman

Manuel Bianco

Master craftsman specializing in traditional Costa Rican handicrafts. His work reflects the rich cultural heritage of the Osa Peninsula.

Juan Carlos

Creates unique pieces inspired by local wildlife and nature. Known for his attention to detail and use of sustainable materials.

Hubert

Skilled artisan crafting authentic souvenirs that capture the essence of Puerto Jiménez and its surroundings.

Coco

Specializes in local crafts using traditional techniques passed down through generations.

Pica Piedra

Master stoneworker creating beautiful pieces from local materials. Each piece tells a unique story of the region.

Claudia Mariposa

Creates stunning butterfly-inspired art pieces that capture the vibrant colors and natural beauty of the Osa Peninsula.

Hotel Costa Verde is a great hotel in the area. It is a great place to stay for anyone looking to explore the area.

Transportation

By Plane

The fastest and most convenient way to reach Puerto Jiménez. Several domestic airlines operate daily flights from San José International Airport.

Direct Bus Service

Take the Transportes Blanco bus from San José (Caribbean Bus Terminal) directly to Puerto Jiménez. Departs at 12:00 PM daily. Journey time approximately 8 hours.

Bus via Golfito

Alternative route via Tracopa bus to Rio Claro, then connecting to Golfito. Choose between coastal or mountain routes. Includes a scenic ferry crossing to Puerto Jiménez.

Ferry Service

Regular ferry service between Golfito and Puerto Jiménez. Multiple departures daily, offering beautiful views of the Golfo Dulce. Limited capacity available.

Local Transportation

Various local transport options including taxis and rental cars are available for getting around Puerto Jiménez and exploring the Osa Peninsula.
